definitions: student with highest academic achievement who delivers farewell speech at graduation ceremony
examples: Sarah was chosen as valedictorian for her outstanding grades
The valedictorian delivered an inspiring speech about perseverance

definitions: card exchanged to express love on Valentine's Day
person who receives romantic affection especially on February fourteenth
examples: She made handmade valentines for her classmates
He bought chocolates and a valentine for his girlfriend
Will you be my valentine this year
She waited hopefully for her valentine to arrive

definitions: person who parks cars for guests at hotels or restaurants
male servant who attends to personal needs and clothing
examples: The valet took their car keys at the entrance
Restaurant valets earn most of their income from tips
The wealthy businessman employed a valet for decades
His valet laid out fresh clothes every morning

definitions: process of checking that something meets requirements or standards
recognition and acceptance of someone's thoughts feelings or behaviors as legitimate
examples: The software requires validation before final release
Parking validation saves customers from paying fees
Children need validation from their parents to build confidence
She sought validation for her difficult decision

definitions: great courage shown in the face of danger especially in battle
examples: The soldier received a medal for exceptional valor
Stories of valor inspired the young recruits

definitions: professional assessment of how much something is worth especially property or business
examples: The house valuation came in higher than expected
Company valuation determines the stock price during IPO

definitions: mechanical device that controls flow of liquids or gases through pipes
structure in heart or veins that prevents blood from flowing backward
examples: Turn the valve clockwise to stop water flow
The plumber replaced the faulty valve under the sink
Heart valve surgery saved his life last year
The mitral valve separates the left chambers

definitions: front upper part of a shoe or boot covering the foot
woman who uses sexual attraction to exploit or manipulate others
examples: The leather vamp showed signs of wear
Designer shoes often feature decorative vamps
The film noir featured a classic vamp character
She played the vamp role in the theater production

definitions: person who deliberately destroys or damages public or private property
examples: Vandals spray-painted graffiti on the school walls
Security cameras help identify vandals in the area

definitions: deliberate destruction or damage of public or private property as criminal behavior
examples: The park closed temporarily due to recent vandalism
Vandalism costs the city thousands in repairs annually

definitions: flat piece that shows wind direction by turning with air currents
blade of a turbine propeller or similar rotating machine
examples: The weather vane on the barn pointed north
Old farmhouses often feature decorative weather vanes
Turbine vanes must be precisely balanced for efficiency
The windmill vanes turned slowly in the breeze

definitions: group of people leading the way in new developments or ideas
examples: Artists often form the vanguard of social change
The company positioned itself at the vanguard of technology

definitions: sweet flavoring extracted from tropical orchid seed pods
most basic or ordinary version of something without special features
examples: She added vanilla extract to the cookie dough
Madagascar produces the world's finest vanilla beans
They ordered the vanilla version without any upgrades
His taste in music is pretty vanilla

definitions: act or process of disappearing gradually from sight or existence
examples: The vanishing of arctic ice concerns climate scientists
His sudden vanishing from the party puzzled everyone

definitions: excessive pride in one's appearance achievements or qualities
bathroom cabinet containing sink and storage space for toiletries
examples: His vanity prevented him from admitting mistakes
Social media often feeds people's vanity
The marble vanity complemented the bathroom design perfectly
She stored makeup in the vanity drawers

definitions: place or position giving a good view or strategic advantage
examples: From this vantage we can see the entire valley
The hilltop provided an excellent vantage for photography

definitions: electronic device that heats liquid to produce vapor for inhalation
examples: He switched from cigarettes to a vape device
Many shops now sell vapes and vaping supplies

definitions: act of inhaling vapor produced by electronic cigarettes or similar devices
examples: Vaping has become popular among former smokers
Schools struggle with students vaping in bathrooms

definitions: visible gas or mist formed when liquid evaporates or solid sublimes
examples: Water vapor rose from the hot springs naturally
The cold air made their breath visible as vapor

definitions: process of converting liquid or solid into vapor through heating or pressure reduction
examples: Vaporization occurs when water reaches its boiling point
The vaporization of fuel powers internal combustion engines

definitions: quality of being subject to variation or changes in character amount or degree
examples: Weather variability makes long-term predictions difficult
Genetic variability helps species adapt to environmental changes

definitions: measure of how spread out numbers are from their average value
official permission to do something differently from normal rules or regulations
examples: The variance in test scores was surprisingly high
Statisticians calculate variance to understand data distribution
They applied for a zoning variance to build higher
The board granted a variance for the historic building

definitions: form or version that differs in some respect from others of same type
examples: Scientists discovered a new variant of the virus
This variant spelling appears in British English

definitions: wine made primarily from a single variety of grape and labeled accordingly
examples: The winery specializes in single varietal wines
Chardonnay remains a popular white wine varietal

definitions: clear liquid coating that dries to form hard protective finish on wood
examples: Apply varnish after the stain has completely dried
The antique table needs a fresh coat of varnish

definitions: principal team representing a school or college in sports competition
examples: She made the varsity basketball team as a sophomore
Varsity players receive special letter jackets

definitions: decorative container typically used for holding cut flowers or as ornament
examples: She arranged roses in the crystal vase
Ancient Greek vases often depicted mythological scenes

definitions: minor surgical procedure that cuts tubes carrying sperm as permanent birth control
examples: He scheduled a vasectomy after their third child
Vasectomy reversal is possible but not always successful

definitions: person holding land from feudal lord in return for homage and service
examples: Medieval vassals owed military service to their lords
The vassal pledged loyalty in the ceremony

definitions: large tank or container for holding liquids especially in industrial processes
examples: Brewery vats hold thousands of gallons of beer
Workers stirred the dye in enormous vats

definitions: theatrical entertainment popular in early twentieth century featuring various acts like comedy music and dance
examples: His grandfather performed comedy routines in vaudeville
Vaudeville theaters once dominated American entertainment

definitions: reinforced room for storing valuables or important documents securely
arched structure forming ceiling or roof especially in churches
athletic jump using hands for support or pole for height
examples: The bank vault requires two keys to open
They stored gold bars in the underground vault
The cathedral's vault displayed beautiful painted frescoes
Stone vaults characterize Gothic architecture
Her vault scored perfectly in the gymnastics competition
Pole vault requires both speed and technique

definitions: architectural technique of constructing arched ceilings and roofs
sport of performing jumps using apparatus like poles or horses
examples: The vaulting in medieval churches required skilled stonemasons
Ribbed vaulting allowed for taller cathedral ceilings
She excels at vaulting in track and field
Vaulting requires years of training and practice

definitions: meat from young calves typically pale and tender
examples: The restaurant serves veal parmesan as their specialty
Many people avoid veal for ethical reasons

definitions: organism that transmits disease or parasite from one host to another
quantity having both magnitude and direction represented by an arrow
examples: Mosquitoes serve as vectors for malaria transmission
Scientists study vectors to prevent disease spread
The physics student calculated force vectors for homework
Wind velocity is represented as a vector

definitions: person who avoids all animal products including meat dairy eggs and leather
examples: The vegan ordered the plant-based burger option
More restaurants now offer vegan menu choices

definitions: person who does not eat meat but may consume dairy and eggs
examples: The vegetarian chose pasta primavera for dinner
Many vegetarians eat cheese and eggs regularly

definitions: practice of abstaining from eating meat for health ethical or environmental reasons
examples: Vegetarianism has grown more popular among young people
Her vegetarianism began for health reasons

definitions: plants considered collectively especially those found in particular area or habitat
examples: Dense vegetation covered the abandoned building completely
Desert vegetation adapts to survive with minimal water

definitions: piece of fabric worn to cover head or face for modesty or ceremony
something that hides obscures or disguises the truth
examples: The bride wore a delicate lace veil
Some women wear veils for religious reasons
Secrecy cast a veil over the negotiations
They lifted the veil on corporate corruption

definitions: blood vessel that carries blood toward the heart
layer of ore or mineral within rock formation
particular style manner or mode of expression
examples: The nurse found a vein for the IV quickly
Veins appear blue through pale skin
Gold veins in the rock excited the miners
The marble has beautiful veins running through it
He continued speaking in a humorous vein
Her writing follows in the vein of classic mysteries

definitions: small feathered dinosaur known for speed and sharp claws that lived during Cretaceous period
examples: The velociraptor skeleton impressed museum visitors greatly
Movies often exaggerate the velociraptor's actual size

definitions: rate of movement in specific direction measured as distance over time
examples: The rocket reached escape velocity within minutes
Wind velocity determines how storms will travel

definitions: fabric with dense soft pile made from silk cotton or synthetic fibers
examples: The velvet curtains added elegance to the theater
She wore a deep purple velvet dress

definitions: prolonged bitter feud marked by retaliatory acts of revenge between families or groups
examples: The vendetta between the families lasted for generations
His personal vendetta clouded his professional judgment

definitions: business of selling goods through coin-operated machines
examples: The vending company services machines throughout the city
Vending has expanded beyond snacks to electronics

definitions: thin decorative layer of fine wood applied to cheaper material
attractive appearance that hides less pleasant reality
examples: Oak veneer covered the particle board furniture
The dentist applied porcelain veneers to her teeth
His polite veneer masked deep-seated anger
The veneer of civilization disappeared during the crisis
